stakeholder.translation[0].definitions[0: someone who has invested money into something, or who has some important connection with it, and therefore is affected by its success or failure
Citizens should be stakeholders in the society they live in.
stakeholder.translation[0].definitions[1: someone, usually a lawyer, who takes charge of a property during a quarrel or a sale
stakeholder.translation[0].definitions[2: someone chosen to hold the money that is risked by people on a race, competition etc and to give all of it to the winner
stakeholder.translation[1].definitions[0: a person who is considered to be an important part of an organization or of society because they have responsibility within it and receive advantages from it
Chief executives of international companies want to spend more personal time on stakeholder issues. By ‘stakeholder’, we mean staff and the local community.
stakeholder.translation[1].definitions[1: someone who owns shares in a company
The organization’s big stockmarket investments make it an important stakeholder in Lebanon’s economy.
